{
  "article_text": [
    "experimental information on low - lying single - particle excited states are available for many nuclei . because of the advancement in experimental techniques now it is possible to populate high spin states of nuclei beyond ni .",
    "these experimental results are stringent test for the predicting power of shell model for high spin excited states .",
    "it is possible to test two - body matrix elements for predicting the high - spin states which are generated by aligning the angular momenta due to broken nucleon pairs .",
    "the nuclei in sr - zr region show many interesting features , such as spherical shell , isomeric states , candidates of double and neutrinoless double beta decay @xcite .",
    "high spin states of @xmath6zr have been recently populated up to @xmath2 20@xmath7 and an excitation energy of  10 mev was measured in @xmath8se(@xmath9c,5n)@xmath6zr fusion evaporation reaction  @xcite .",
    "similarly , the high spin states of @xmath10zr were populated using the fusion evaporation reaction @xmath8se(@xmath9c,@xmath11)@xmath10zr .",
    "the observed high - spin states up to 10 mev excitation energy and spin @xmath2 37/2@xmath7 are reported in ref .",
    "the dominance of single - particle excitations is shown for both positive and negative parity states .",
    "the high - spin band structure of @xmath12sr was populated in the reaction @xmath13ge(@xmath9c,@xmath11)@xmath12sr @xcite .",
    "the spin and parity of different levels up to the spin of @xmath2 35/2@xmath7 and an excitation energy @xmath2 7.5 mev were established . here",
    "shell model explains various features , such as the odd - even staggering , very well . in the case of @xmath14sr",
    "the high - spin states were populated using @xmath13ge(@xmath9c,@xmath15)@xmath14sr reaction .",
    "the level scheme up to 10.9 mev excitation energy and maximum spin of @xmath2 19@xmath7 have been reported in ref .",
    "@xcite .",
    "experimentally , the high - spin structure of @xmath0sr previously was studied in refs .",
    "recently , using the fusion - evaporation reaction @xmath16se(@xmath17be,@xmath11)@xmath0sr , the states were populated up to an excitation energy of 7.4 mev at spin 31/2@xmath7 reported in ref .",
    "the structure of high spin states using in - beam @xmath18-ray spectroscopic method @xmath0zr was studied through the @xmath19co(@xmath20s,@xmath21)@xmath0zr reaction @xcite , the level scheme was established up to spin ( 37/2@xmath22 ) and ( 43/2@xmath23 ) .    motivated by the success of our shell model results in this region for recently measured high spin states of @xmath6zr@xcite , @xmath10zr  @xcite , @xmath12sr  @xcite and @xmath14sr  @xcite , in the present work we will be focusing on the shell model study of recently populated high - spin states of @xmath0sr and @xmath0zr .",
    "in the present shell model calculations @xmath24ni is taken as the inert core with the spherical orbits @xmath25 , @xmath26 , @xmath27 and @xmath28 .",
    "we have performed calculation with the jj44b and jun45 effective interactions .",
    "the jj44b interaction was fitted with 600 binding energies and excitation energies from nuclei with @xmath29 and @xmath30 available in this region . here , 30 linear combinations of @xmath31 coupled two - body matrix elements ( tbme ) are varied , giving the rms deviation of about 250 kev from the experiment .",
    "the single particle energies ( spe ) are taken to be -9.656 , -9.287 , -8.269 and -5.894 mev for the @xmath32 , @xmath33 , @xmath34 and @xmath35 orbitals , respectively @xcite . for the jun45 , the single - particle energies for the 1@xmath32 , 0@xmath33 , 1@xmath34 and 0@xmath35 orbitals are -9.828 , -8.709 , -7.839 , and -6.262 mev , respectively . the jun45 @xcite interaction is based on bonn - c potential , the single - particle energies and two - body matrix elements",
    "were modified empirically with a = 63@xmath269 mass region .",
    "we have performed calculations using the shell model code antoine @xcite . the maximum matrix dimension in m - scheme @xmath36 @xmath37 millions for @xmath0zr .",
    "experimental data are available from the earlier works  @xcite and recent work  @xcite , where the states are populated up to the excitation energy of 7.4 mev with 31/2@xmath7 spin .",
    "useful structural information can be extracted through the study of this nucleus since both number of protons and neutrons are near closed shells and in this region spherical and collective behaviors of nuclei are important . in fig .",
    "1 the comparison of our shell model calculation with the experimental data are shown , where we have used two different jun45 and jj44b interactions .",
    "the ground state @xmath38 , which comes from the @xmath39 configuration , is predicted correctly by both calculations . in the jun45 calculation",
    "the values of @xmath40 and @xmath41 energy levels are only 65 kev lower and 3 kev higher than in the experiment , respectively . in the jj44b calculation",
    "they are 86 kev lower and 351 kev higher than in the experiment , respectively .",
    "the @xmath42 , @xmath43 , @xmath44 and @xmath45 levels are closer to the experiment in the jj44b calculation .",
    "the @xmath46 level is far from experiment almost at the same amount in the both calculations .",
    "the @xmath47 level comes from the @xmath48 configuration .",
    "it is predicted 163 kev and 178 kev lower than in the experiment in the jun45 and jj44b calculations , respectively .    as is seen from fig .",
    "1 all the @xmath49 - @xmath50 levels are predicted lower than in the experiment in the jun45 calculation . in the jj44b calculation",
    "these levels are little bit lower than even in the jun45 calculation up to @xmath51 , but @xmath52 and @xmath50 levels are well predicted by this calculation . according to the both shell model calculations these states come from @xmath53 configuration .",
    "probabilities vary within  35% -  60% and  24% -  49% in the calculations with the jun45 and jj44b interactions , respectively .",
    "the jun45 calculation predicts @xmath54 and @xmath55 levels in the experiment only with 71 kev and with 279 kev differences , respectively . in the jj44b calculation",
    "they are comparatively low .",
    "the negative parity @xmath56 , @xmath57 , @xmath58 , @xmath59 and @xmath60 levels , which are due to the neutrons in @xmath61 shell , are better predicted by the jun45 calculation . the @xmath62 level which appears in both calculations is not measured yet in the experiment , although experimentally the doublet of levels ( @xmath58,@xmath62 ) is supposed to be at 2656 kev .",
    "the negative parity @xmath63 - @xmath64 states are due to @xmath65 configuration , with  35% -  64% and  33% -  53% probabilities , in the calculations with jun45 and jj44b interactions , respectively . as is seen from fig .",
    "1 though the distance between @xmath66 and @xmath67 is larger and those of between the pair of levels @xmath68 and @xmath69 , and @xmath70 and @xmath71 are more compressed , in general the negative parity states are described reasonably well by jun45 calculation . in jj44b calculation all negative parity levels , except @xmath72 , are lower than in the jun45 calculation .    sr . ]",
    "the structure of high spin states of @xmath0zr was studied using in - beam @xmath18-ray spectroscopic method through the @xmath19co(@xmath20s,3pn)@xmath0zr @xcite .",
    "positive parity level scheme was established up to spin ( 37/2@xmath22 ) and the negative parity level scheme up to ( 43/2@xmath23 ) .    as in the case of @xmath0sr ground state spin of the @xmath0zr",
    "is also @xmath73 since still neutrons in the @xmath35 orbital play major role for the ground state .",
    "now we see that less energy is needed in order to excite nuclei to @xmath47 state .",
    "this is reasonable since now neutrons are little bit further from the filling @xmath35 orbital as compared to the @xmath0sr nucleus . in the calculation with jun45 interaction",
    "the @xmath38 , @xmath74 , @xmath75 , @xmath76 , @xmath77 , @xmath52 , @xmath50 , @xmath78 , @xmath79 and @xmath80 states have the configuration @xmath81 with probabilities  12% -  31% .",
    "the @xmath82 , @xmath49 and @xmath83 states have the configuration @xmath84\\otimes\\nu ( g_{9/2})^{-3}$ ] . here",
    "the lower proton orbitals contribute to the configuration of these states . in the calculation with jj44b interaction , the @xmath38 , @xmath82 , @xmath74 , @xmath75 , @xmath77 and @xmath83 states have @xmath85\\otimes\\nu ( g_{9/2})^{-3}$ ] configuration .    from fig .",
    "2 we can see that between the pair of levels @xmath38 and @xmath74 there are @xmath82 and @xmath86 levels and between the @xmath74 and @xmath49 levels there are @xmath75 and @xmath87 levels in the experiment . in both calculations",
    "the @xmath88 and @xmath82 levels appear between the @xmath38 and @xmath74 levels , and the @xmath86 level appears after the @xmath75 level . in fig .  2 we have not shown the levels for which spins are not assigned in the experiment .",
    "but in the experiment there exist spin not assigned levels with energies 523.7 and 589.7 kev  @xcite which are close to the calculated @xmath40 level .",
    "the @xmath82 is close to the experiment in jj44b , but the @xmath86 level is much higher in both calculations . in the jun45 calculation",
    "@xmath75 and @xmath87 levels are between @xmath74 and @xmath49 levels as in the experiment , but in jj44b calculation @xmath87 level is located after @xmath49 level .",
    "the @xmath89 , @xmath90 , @xmath91 , and @xmath92 levels can be spin not assigned levels observed in the experiment  @xcite .",
    "the levels @xmath76 and @xmath77 are only 22 and 79 kev higher than in the experiment in the jj44b calculation , respectively . between these levels there are @xmath92 and @xmath93 levels which also appear in the jun45 calculation and are not measured in the experiment . in the jun45 calculation between the levels @xmath77 and @xmath52 , which are lower than in the experiment in both calculations , there are @xmath94 and @xmath95 levels .",
    "they are not measured in the experiment . in the jj44b calculation only @xmath51 level",
    "appears between the levels @xmath77 and @xmath52 . the sequence of levels @xmath52 and @xmath83 are the same with the experimental one in both jun45 and jj44b calculations . though the distance between the levels are quite similar to the experiment , in the jun45 calculation they are little bit lower than in the experiment . in the jj44b calculation",
    "the first of these levels is only 79 kev higher and the second one is 208 kev lower than in the experiment and the distance between the levels is little bit compressed as compared to the experiment and the jun45 calculation .        for @xmath96 states",
    "the @xmath97\\otimes\\nu [ ( f_{5/2}^{-1}g_{9/2}^{-2}]$ ] configuration dominates .",
    "agreement of the calculated @xmath98 level with the experimental one is approximately the same in both calculations .",
    "however the @xmath99 level is in better agreement with the experimental one in the jj44b calculation and is lower in the jun45 calculation .",
    "the @xmath100 level is located higher than in the experiment in both calculations . in the jun45 calculation",
    "its value is closer to the experimental one than in the jj44b calculation .",
    "the @xmath101 level is predicted lower than in the experiment in the jun45 calculation and is predicted higher in the jj44b calculation .",
    "the arrangement of lowest negative parity levels of @xmath0zr are very similar to those of @xmath0sr . as in the case of",
    "@xmath0sr we have not shown the levels for which spins are not assigned in the experiment",
    ". therefore @xmath57 , @xmath58 , @xmath62 and @xmath102 levels which appear in the calculations may be one of this spin not assigned levels .",
    "obviously these levels are due to the neutrons in @xmath61 shell . in jj44b",
    "the @xmath56 level is predicted much lower than in the experiment . in the jun45 calculation",
    "it is predicted only 26 kev higher than in the experiment .",
    "the @xmath63 , @xmath103 , @xmath104 , @xmath105 , @xmath106 , @xmath107 and @xmath108 levels come from @xmath109 configuration with  6% -  18% probabilities , respectively .",
    "all these levels are lower than in the experiment in both calcilations .",
    "the @xmath63 , @xmath103 , @xmath104 levels are better described by the jun45 interaction . the quality of agreement of @xmath105 and @xmath106 levels is more or less the same in both calculations .",
    "the @xmath107 and @xmath108 levels are closer to the experiment in the calculation with jj44b interaction .",
    "the @xmath110 state comes from @xmath111 configuration which is close to the experiment in the jun45 calculation and the jj44 calculation differs from the jun45 only to 20 kev .",
    "the states @xmath112 , @xmath113 , @xmath72 , @xmath114 , and @xmath115 levels come from @xmath116 configuration with  16% -  38% probabilities , respectively .",
    "the @xmath112 , @xmath113 and @xmath114 levels are in better agreement in the jun45 calculation , while @xmath72 , and @xmath115 are better in the jj44b calculation .",
    "the @xmath117 , @xmath118 , and @xmath119 levels come from @xmath120 configuration with  24% -  50% probabilities , respectively .",
    "these states are described well by the calculation with jj44b interaction .",
    "the experimental @xmath121 level is measured at 10093 kev .",
    "the jun45 and jj44b calculations predict this level at 9716 kev and at 10527 kev , respectively .",
    "@xmath0sr    sr . ]      in order to look closely to the structure of the states we show the occupancy of different protons and neutrons orbitals for @xmath0sr and @xmath0zr nuclei with jun45 interaction in figs .  3 and 4 , respectively .",
    "as is seen from fig .  3 , for the positive parity states in @xmath0sr the occupancy of the proton orbitals are sensitive to the nuclear spin , including states up to high spins . here",
    "the @xmath122 occupancy is increasing at the expense of @xmath123 and @xmath124 occupancy .",
    "for the negative parity states the dependence of the occupancy of the proton orbitals from the spins still remains same , however now the neutron occupancy at lower spins shows irregular pattern . for negative parity states the occupancy of @xmath122 is increasing at the expense of the @xmath124 orbital occupancy only .    from fig .",
    "4 one can see that the proton occupancy becomes more stable up to high spins in the positive parity states of the @xmath0zr nucleus as compared to the @xmath0sr nucleus .",
    "the visible changes in the occupancy with respect to spins can be seen in @xmath35 orbital , the increase in the occupancy is at the expense of the @xmath124 orbital occupancy only , as in the case of @xmath0sr .",
    "@xmath0zr    zr . ]",
    ".[be2]experimental and calculated @xmath125 and @xmath126 in w.u . for different transitions with @xmath127=1.5e , @xmath128=1.1e .",
    "[ cols=\">,>,>,>,>\",options=\"header \" , ]",
    "in table  [ be2 ] , we have reported experimental versus calculated @xmath125 and @xmath126 values in w.u . with different transitions",
    ". all the @xmath125 values of @xmath0sr are in better agreement with the experiment in both calculations and @xmath125 values of @xmath0zr are predicted much larger than in the experiment in both calculations .",
    "we have used the recommended @xmath127=1.5e , @xmath128=1.1e values of effective charges  @xcite in the jun45 interaction .",
    "larger neutron effective charge is more reasonable in this mass region which is adopted by honma _",
    "@xcite from the least - squares fit to the 49 known experimental values of quadrupole moments . with the @xmath129=(1.5,1.1 )",
    "the agreement between theory and experiment is very good . in the present work ,",
    "large @xmath125 values are due to many nucleons in the valence shells and the agreement may be improved by slightly reducing the effective charges .",
    "quality of the magnetic moment agreement with the experimental data is also like quadrupole moments : the magnetic moments of @xmath0sr are better described by the calculations .",
    "the electric quadrupole and magnetic moments we have listed in tables  [ qm ] and  [ mm ] , respectively . for the @xmath0sr nucleus the @xmath130 value is + 0.349 eb according to the calculation with jun45 interaction , which is closest to the experimental + 0.305(2 ) eb value .",
    "the jj44b predicts the value larger than experimental one . in the case of @xmath0zr ,",
    "the @xmath130 value is lower for jun45 , while for jj44b it is very large .",
    "though in general quadrupole moments are in excellent agreement with the experimental data , the agreement still can be improved by reducing effective charges which is reasonable for these nuclei .",
    "the shape of @xmath0sr is more spherical than @xmath0zr in the @xmath82 state according to the quadrupole moment values calculated by both interactions for this state .",
    "for the calculation of magnetic moments , @xmath131 = 0.7@xmath132 is used as recommended in the ref .",
    "the results of jun45 interaction , is in very good agreement with experimental data . in the case of jj44b calculation",
    "the predicted value is slightly lower . here",
    "@xmath131 = @xmath132 may improve the results .",
    "motivated by recent experimental results for high - spin states in @xmath0sr and @xmath0zr , we performed shell model calculations for these nuclei in @xmath1 model space using jun45 and jj44b effective interactions .",
    "the results for energy levels and electromagnetic transitions are presented .",
    "the high spin energy levels are described very well by the effective interactions for the full @xmath1 model space . in general",
    "both effective interactions show very good agreement with the experimental data , for @xmath0zr , the jj44b interaction predicts negative parity states beyond @xmath3 higher in energy .",
    "the calculated values of quadrupole moment are in good agreement with available experimental data .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in the present work we report a comprehensive analysis of shell model results for high - spin states of @xmath0sr and @xmath0zr for recently available experimental data within the full @xmath1 model space using jun45 and jj44b effective interactions developed for this model space . in this work </S>",
    "<S> we have compared the energy levels , electromagnetic transition probabilities , quadrupole and magnetic moments with available experimental data . we have confirmed structure of high - spin states of these two nuclei which were tentatively assigned in the recent experimental work . in the case of @xmath0sr , </S>",
    "<S> for positive parity states up to @xmath2 7.5 mev , both interactions predict very good agreement with experimental data , while negative parity states are slightly suppressed in jj44b calculation . for the @xmath0zr nucleus , the jj44b interaction predicts higher energies for the negative parity states beyond @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> the configuration , which have one hole in @xmath4 orbital , is responsible for generating the states in @xmath0sr . in the case of @xmath0zr , low - lying positive parity states come with the configuration having three holes in the @xmath4 , while the odd - parity states have configuration @xmath5 . </S>"
  ]
}
